Everything was blurry, everywhere was dust flying through the air. Slowly, Alex's vision began to sharpen, as well as his mind, trying to comprehend what had happened just now.

Where was he? After a while, he realized he was lying on the ground, face towards the ground, still inside the forest on the hills near the town. Why was he on the ground? Oh yeah, there was an explosion. Did his car blew up? Rolling on his back, he looked to his left. The red colour of his car was mainly covered by dirt and dust, but it looked like it was okay. When checking the status of his car, another question came into his mind: Was he injured?

Carefully, he moved his arms towards the sky, testing if they were okay. They didn't seem to be broken, only dirty like the rest of his body. Then, leaning on his arms, he raised his upper-body to examine his legs. As he looked at his dirty trousers, he noticed something ahead in the dust. When looking closer, he nearly fell back out of shock, his heart making a big leap. At first he thought to be imagining thing, still confused from the explosion. But as the dust fell, his eyes grew wider, not believing what they were looking at.

Ten meters in front of him, a girl was laying on the ground. She was wearing a white dress, though it was very dirty now, which looked like those the Romans used to wear. Her long, gray hair was falling into her face. She wore no shoes, her skin being almost as white as her dress had probably been. But what really stunned him about her was that she seemed to be carrying something on her back, something big and white, somehow fluffy looking, resembling... wings.

At first Alex thought to be crazy, seeing an angel laying in front of him. Then he noticed white feathers were scattered around the girl. "Could it be?" he whispered. Looking around, he noticed nothing seemed to be broken by the explosion, only dust had been whirled up. He was curious, but at the same time scared. And in disbelief. An angel? Could this really be true? No, impossible. This was impossible. Still, he was curious.

Slowly, he managed to get to his feet. He really seemed not to be hurt, though he was send flying at least five meters. Carefully, he moved towards the girl, each step seeming to take an eternity. His heart was pounding. As he got closer, he was confessed the white things on her back were really wings, each one being at least the size of her body. Finally, he stood in front of her, his feet nearly touching her face. Alex waited for a moment, then knelt down, his head now inches away from hers. He reached out his hand - it was shaking. After hesitating one last time, he pulled her hair out of her face, fixing it behind her ear.

The girl's eyes were closed, she was probably unconscious. Her face didn't really look like he imagined it: Surely pretty, but not heavenly beautiful like to be expected it from an angel. He scratched his head, trying to put together what had just happened, when suddenly, she opened her eyes.

Screaming, Alex immediately fell back, his heart beating even faster now as he quickly crawled backwards. He was scared even more when he noticed her eyes were different coloured, her left one being red while the other one was blue. He tried to calm down, which ultimately failed as he saw her hair colour was getting lighter, until becoming completely white. No doubt about it now: This was not an ordinary person.

Then, Alex noticed something as he looked at her face again: She was scared. Biting her lips, she looked at him as if he was a lion and she a wounded animal. He put together all his courage, opening his mouth:

"D-don't worry, I-I w-won't h-harm you." He actually wanted to calm her down like a father, but if his words really eased her fear, then only because she knew now he was at least as scared as she was.

There was a long silence. The birds had not returned yet, no wind seemed to be blowing. Sweat was dropping from Alex' face. His heart was not racing anymore; actually, it felt like it was not beating at all. No one of them did or say anything. They just looked at each other.

Suddenly, a breeze came up, blowing leaves off the trees. He could hear a bird chirping in the distance. The angel or whatever she was rose her head slightly. Alex swallowed. "Um..." He felt like he had to say something, but didn't know what. Finally, at the risk of saying something wrong, he just spoke out what he was wondering about the whole time:

"Are... are you an... angel?"

"Yes."

"Yes." she finally answered.

"W-Why?"

Another pause. "I..." She was lowering her head, looking at the soil. "I..." Her hair started to get darker, over dim grey to completely black. Shortly after, he could hear her sobbing.

"N-never mind!" he quickly said, thinking about something else to ask. "Um... A - are you hurt?"

She swallowed her tears, nodding slightly. Alex, still sitting on the ground, got back to his feet.

"Shall I bring you to a hospital?" he offered, noticing he wasn't stuttering anymore. The angel's arm moved to her face, wiping the tears from her eyes.

"Well..." She paused, not looking at him. "Well, I... my injuries... they... they will heal up themselves, but... it may need a few days, so..." Her hair was turning white again. "If... if you would... it would be nice if you could... um..."

"You need a place to rest, huh?" he finished the sentence for her. She nodded, looking nervously into his eyes. Alex scratched his head. What should he do now? Find a hotel for her? But if she was injured, he couldn't leave her alone. Maybe he should take her to a hospital... on the other hand though, hospitals were expansive, and if she really healed up by herself, it was a waste of money - probably his money, as he couldn't imagine an angel to carry money.

Finally, he made up his mind: "Okay, you can stay at my place for a few weeks if you like. But I'll warn you: My apartment's tiny."

A smile came into the angel's face. "Thanks." she said. Her hair was changing colour again, this time turning blond. Blushing, Alex looked away. Now she really looked like an angel.

"C-can you stand up?" he quickly asked. She looked down at herself, her hair becoming brown now.

"I'm... afraid I can't... not by myself" Alex walked over to her, trying to help her up, but her wings were too heavy. "Wait." She moved her arm towards her chest, pressing her thumb against it. Her wings started to glow, like they were made out of light, then vanished inside her body.

As she got on her feet, he put an arm under her shoulder, leading her to his car. "I'm Sarina." she suddenly said. He smiled.

"Alex." he said "Nice to meet you!" She smiled back at him, her hair turning blond again.

"Already did." Becky replied, leaning back. Both women were laying against the roof of a small cabin, which aside from a rundown barn beside it was the only standing structure around for miles. Becky took a deep breath.

"High point of our night, I guess. I think it's nice your parents put me up for the summer...but how do you not get bored around here?"

---

Perhaps she had come here purposefully and then something had happened. That idea stuck with Sarina, but she was awash with doubt.

Sarina looked down despondently. Reality further sunk in as she looked at her injured body. It was true; His Domain was a place of peace, free of all pain and woes. But here...

"Anyway, we were worried you wouldn't pull through. Er, pun unintended, but the doctor said it was nothing short of a miracle you survived. I guess being an Angel means healing faster than a human. Anyway, you've been kept on IV for a time so you're probably hungry."

The fallen angel looked over at the tube in her arm? IV? This strange object?

The nurse brought Sarina food she'd never seen before. It was different then the fruits in His Domain, but had a humble quality to it. Not only that, she needed utensils to eat some, like the 'mashed potatoes' and steak and the "jello" the nurse brought her after for dessert. It had felt strangely compelling, eating like this as she sat in the hospital like this. She would call for more food at times. Seconds, even thirds, for almost every meal of the day. She would ask for snacks regularly, partaking in the wonder that was human food.

However, this of coursed caused her to gain more weight within less than a week. Her body looked a tad softer and she had lightly more feminine features, as opposed to her rather androgynous figure such as curvier and wider hips as well as slightly more defined breasts and a softer belly that her fingers seemed to lightly sink into as she pressed against it. After a while, however...

141.content:
A small form fell from the sky over medieval earth, twisting and turning as it plummeted. A pair of wings spread out just in time to right the form, which may not have been the best idea, as it fell face-first into a snowdrift after setting itself properly for being in the air. "Ungh...." Came a feminine voice from the hole in the drift, as the figure inside; a woman with a pair of wings, lay unconscious. The fall would have been deadly had the snow not been there, but now, if she wasn't fished out, her odds would be just as grim. But luck was on her side today, as a woman dressed in thick furs dragged the mysterious winged girl to a warm log-cabin, a fire roaring in a hearth.

The girl woke up to find she was lying on a couch, covered in a blanked and her warm wings. She looked around, and spotted the girl, who now had her hood down, revealing Long black hair that went to her waist, and a fair, beautiful face. "Who are you?" The girl asked, the woman jumping a bit, before she realized the girl had just woken up. She went and fetched a pair of mugs filled with warm tea, and sat beside the girl.

"I'm Kana, but I feel I should be asking you that question..." the Woman said, handing her a cup, which she gratefully took and drank.

"I'm Sarina." she said between sips, feeling the warmth return to her fingers and face, and slowly her body.

"Sarina..A wonderful name. Tell me, are you what I think you are?"

"An angel? Yes...Fallen, to be exact."

"What do you mean, fallen?"

"I was kicked out of heaven..."

"That's terrible! Why?"

"A crime I was accused of, but never even committed."

"How horrible! What happened?"

"Well...." Sarina began, not sure where to start. "I was always known as a fun-lover, a wild-card, or a trickster among the angels. My antics were the joy of some, the annoyance of others. Then, one day, I met a girl who looked just like me, but she didn't have a pair of wings like I did, and her hair always stayed the same color, unlike mine, as you can see..." she continued, her hair changing colors as she went through different thoughts as she recalled the story. "She also only had blue eyes. But still. She was holding a scepter. She ran past me and knocked me over before anything could be done. It took me a moment to realize what the girl had. She had taken God's own scepter...."

"Oh, my...." Kana said, sitting forward in her chair to listen.

Sarina nodded, and continued. "It was then that a group of armed angels overtook me and grabbed me. They chained me and took me back to God's court. I was accused of stealing the scepter. I was unlucky, as the judges particularly disliked my tricks, and I was sentenced to be cast out, even though I told them I had done nothing, that I would never dare steal God's scepter, that I didn't even know where it was." Her eyes teared up as she finished, and her hair turned pitch black.

"Oh, I'm so sorry..." Kana said, leaning in and giving Sarina a gentle hug. Sarina cried for a short while before composing herself.

"Anyways..."she said, pushing herself out of the embrace quietly. "You have saved me, and even though I'm no longer welcome in heaven, I can still grant wishes to mortals. Ask me anything you want, even ask me for more wishes, but don't ask me to be your slave. That is the one request I can and WILL refuse."

"The thought had never even crossed my mind." Kana said honestly. "I want you to live with me and grant my wishes from now on. You need a place to stay, and I could use some company."

"Clever, but I like you. Done. Anything else?"

"I would like you to be my friend. A real friend."

"I would be glad."

"I'd like my house to be moved someplace warmer, and close to a city. It's hard to live out here on my own."

"Hold on a moment, I'll do that now." Sarina said, and the house was engulfed in a white light. When it faded, they were in a field not too far from a small town. "There, is there anything else?"

"Well, for now, just one more thing. I.........I would like you to become bi-sexual."

"You.......What?" Sarina asked, a bit startled but fairly sure she had a reason.

"You see, that's how I am, and while A boyfriend is nice now and then, I would like to have a female friend or two I can get close to without them freaking out. Don't worry, I won't do anything you don't want to. I respect you."

"*sigh* I know, I'm just afraid of what I WILL want you too. Still, I accept." she said, reformatting her brain to fit the new sexuality. "There. You know, that wasn't much of a change, except now I find you a bit attractive."

"Why thank you." Kana said, smiling.

"Well, I want to get some rest. I'm still not fully healed." Sarina said, yawning before she laid back down.

"Right, you go to sleep. I'll just go to town and get a few things." Kana said, stepping out the front door into her new life.

--------------------------

(3 weeks after the falling.)

"Sarina, I'm home!" Kana called, walking in to find Sarina cooking lunch for the two. They had grown to be almost sisters over a span of 3 weeks. Albeit one sister had mood-hair, two different eyes, wings, and magical powers, but sisters nonetheless.

"Welcome back Kana." Sarina said, pulling a nice-sized chicken from the fire and setting it on a table.

"You know something Sarina..."Kana said, looking at her.

"What?"

"I just now noticed how plain you looked on the outside, despite your wings and hair."

"Oh....."

"Oh, no, no, I'm not making fun of you, I'm just saying, you should be as beautiful on the outside as you are on the inside." Kana said.

"Oh. Well, you have the power over that." Sarina said.

"Good point...."

--------------------------------
Ok, time for Sarina's makeover. Let's go with:

1) Kana wishes Sarina had a bit of a rear and breasts, which she grants, and Sarina admires herself, and makes a few more adjustments. This leads to the two enjoying themselves a bit too much, modifying each other and having fun.

2) Same as #1 but instead of getting an hourglass figure, Sarina casts the wrong spell and packs on a few pounds, which both the girls find nice, and the process of gaining the weight that fast is exhilarating.
141.title: WG, BE, and Butt expansion

142.content:
Alex laid back on the picnic blanket, arms propping up his head. He was smiling. Today was the last day of the semester for college before summer. Finals had passed and he'd finished his engineering courses with top marks and a paper already published. And now all that hustle and bustle was finished. He could finally just lay back and relax.

It seemed perfect that this coincided with the day Murphy's Comet would pass by the Earth, as is does once every 96 years. Alex had seized the opportunity to pack a lunch and drive out to a secluded field that he knew only a few minutes from his apartment. There he could watch the spectacle in piece, the wonders of the universe arcing through the sky above him as the Comet's trail left a meteor shower in it's wake. It was marvelous to see.
But then something caught Alex's eye. One of the faint twinkles that signaled a meteor burning up in the atmosphere didn't go away. Quite to the contrary, it seemed to glow brighter every second.

That's when he heard it; a low rumble steadily growing louder. The light glowed brighter still. Was it getting closer? Alex knew something was definitely wrong. The Comet shouldn't be losing any debris large enough to even impact the Earth, but the flaming ball of rock heading straight for him said differently.When the ground started to tremble, fight or flight instinct kicked in. He tried to scramble to cover, but the meteor impacted the ground before he got far. The was a tremendous explosion, and Alex felt himself sent flying before the world went black.

151.content:
Sarina ended up crash landing on Earth outside of a local suburban town. She landed on the top of a fairly tall hill, her body badly bruised as a result of the fall. The fallen angel barely managed to get herself up with the power of her wings, dusting herself off after she did so. She then took a look around here and wondered where she was, unsure of what planet she even landed on. The angel scanned her surroundings and came to the conclusion that she was alone…but she wasn’t.

Sarina soon noticed a little boy no older than 9 hiding behind a tree, scared by the angel’s earlier crash. He looked to be about 4’5” or so, with short red hair, blue eyes, and a very skinny build. He was wearing a red cap, a blue shirt, jeans, and dark red sneakers. The boy slowly walked up to the fallen angel, still hesitant to even touch her.

“It’s okay. I won’t hurt you”, Sarina comforted the boy. “What’s your name, little one?”

“My name’s Alex”, he replied, looking scared still. “Who are you?”

“I’m Sarina. I’m a fallen angel who came down here from Heaven”, she replied, pointing up at the sky above.

“Wow! Really, Miss? You came from all the way up there, above the clouds?”

“Yep.”

“Then how come you’re down here?”

Sarina’s earlier smile changed to a frown when asked that question. She wasn’t quite ready to talk about that yet.

“I’m sorry, but I can’t tell you right now”, Sarina explained to the boy as she walked up to him and patted his head. “But could you tell me where I am?”

“You’re on Earth, silly!” Alex explained with a joyful, yet also annoyed tone. “And this is Dalesburg!”

“Earth”? Sarina heard of that planet before when she was still a full angel, but she never explored it. Apparently it was full of life, as well as strange animals and people, or so she remembered from her studies. Meanwhile, Alex was further exploring Sarina’s body, starting with her two different colored eyes.

“Hey, Miss, how come you have two different colored eyes? Did you paint one of them?” Alex asked.

“It’s called heterochromia. I was born with these eyes”, Sarina replied with a smile.

“I also notice that your hair changes color. Earlier when you fell it was dark brown, but now it’s blonde. Why’s that? Do you have mood color hair?” Alex continued to badger Sarina.

“Actually, yes. My hair color changes depending on my mood. When I’m happy, it flashes bright colors. When I’m unhappy, it turns dark. It also changes to other various colors depending on my other moods.”

“That’s cool. And your white dress is really pretty, as are your wings”, Alex further commented, causing Sarina to blush.

“You sure are a boy of good taste!” Sarina snickered as she blushed a bit.

“Do you want something to eat, Miss?” Alex wondered, holding out a bag of fruit snacks his mom gave him as a snack for the afternoon.

“Yes. Thank you”, the hungry Sarina replied as she wolfed down the snack in one big gulp.

Wow! Alex gasped.

“Alex, I hate to intrude, but I need a place to heal before I can do much else. Could you perhaps recommend me a place to stay, or perhaps…?”

“Just come to my house!” Alex said. “I’m sure if you explain everything to my parents, they’ll let you stay. Besides, I always wanted an older sister.”

“Really?”

“Not really”, grinned Alex, who was then playfully smacked upside the head by Sarina.


At Alex’s house

It took a lot of struggle to get Sarina to stay at Alex’s house. She had to promise his parents to do chores around the house, as well as baby sit Alex, in order to earn her keep, and even then they only allowed her to stay for 2 weeks. Unfortunately, the house was only built for 3, so Sarina only had two options; sleep on the couch, or sleep with Alex. She chose the latter option as she talked to Alex’s parents outside of their son’s bedroom later that night.

“Alex still gets scared sometimes of the dark, and even now he wets his bed”, explained his mother Amanda, a 30-something housewife with long, red hair and blue eyes. “If you could be there to protect him, it would help us so much, Sarina.”

“I will, Mrs. Alex”, Sarina promised, bowing before her. “You opened your heart enough to let me stay here. Protecting Alex is the least I can do to repay you.”

“Such a nice woman”, added in Joe, Alex’s father, a 39 year-old newspaper editor. “Though I’m confused why you always wear wings.”

“Dad, she’s an angel. Remember?” Alex yelled from inside his room to remind his father, who just shook his head. “Of course she has wings. And they’re real!”

“Alex, go to bed! It’s 9:30 P.M. You should’ve been asleep by now”, Amanda scolded her child.

“Okay”, Alex quietly replied, not wanting to make his mother angry. Sarina then opened the door to his room and sat on the bed beside the boy.

“Alex, are you okay with a girl sleeping in your room?” the angel asked the boy, who looked a little confused but happy.

“It’s okay. I slept with Mom on and off until I was nearly 7. Besides, your wings are so soft!” the cheerful boy replied as he rested his head on the angel’s right wings.

“Thank you, Alex! I promise I’ll make up for this whenever I can!” Sarina told the boy, but he was already fast asleep. Sarina soon joined him, resting on the boy’s surprisingly soft bed and sleeping in a manner of a few minutes. Neither one was aware of the events that were to happen over the following days.
151.title: Angelic Giantess

choices: Sarina works somewhere where her height can be an advantage
Sarina gives her goodbyes to Alex and looks for somewhere else to live
1511.content:
As the days went on, so did Alex's relationship with Sarina grow. Not only did the two play together, but he even wrote her a love poem of sorts when they were playing on the same field they first met at.

"Roses are red,
violets are blue,
candy is sweet,
but not as sweet as you."

"Thank you so much, Alex!" said Sarina as she hugged the young boy. Her hugs seemed to get warmer and a little tighter each day, though Alex had not yet noticed that Sarina slowly grew as the boy's fondness for the angel did. Originally 5'2" when she arrived on Earth, Sarina now stood at 5'9", her dress getting a little tighter each day.

Within the next week it was more noticeable; Sarina was at that point over 6 feet tall! She kept bumping her head on the ceiling, and her feet stuck out of Alex's bed. The angel and boy talked in the latter's backyard that day.

"Sarina, are you growing??" Alex asked.

"It seems so. It seems that the more you like me, the more I grow", Sarina explained.

"Really? So if I said you were beautiful and a godmess.."

"Goddess", corrected Sarina, blushing.

"..you'd grow even more?"

"Probably", Sarina said, nodding.

"I like it when you grow. You get prettier and kinder."

"Thank you", said a red-faced Sarina, now 6'4".

"In fact, Miss Sarina, I love you!" Alex confessed.

"L-L-L-Love?!?!" flushed Sarina, her height quickly escalating upwards from 7 feet..then to 10...then to 20...and even higher up to 65 feet, which it stopped at.

"Wow!!!" the boy gasped at the beautiful giantess angel. "You're the prettiest girl ever!" The comment caused Sarina to grow even more, this time to 68 feet.

"Alex, thank you so much!" Sarina told the boy as she kissed him on both sides of his face. "You have helped me more than you could ever imagine!"

"I'm glad to have helped..but you're too big to live with me now", Alex sighed as she hugged the angel's left foot.

"That's true...but what should I do?"
1511.title: Touched by a giantess angel

choices: Sarina helps a small delivery service deliver packages
15112.content:
"Maybe you could move things around!" Alex suggested. "Like how I can pick up my toy cars and move them across the yard."

"That's a great idea", Sarina replied as she patted the boy lightly on the head. "Thank you for the recommendation!"

"However...are people going to be okay with you being very big?" Alex wondered.

"Yeah. I'm worried about that, too. But we'll never know until we ask!"

Sarina reached out her head for the young Alex to climb on to, which he did. She then placed him on her left shoulder as they slowly walked across the neighborhood, careful not to step on anything. Sarina slightly hovered using the very tips of her wings to fly in the air to prevent causing giant imprints on the ground.

"So far, so good", Sarina noted, smiling as she looked at Alex.

"I'm glad people aren't upset by your size, Miss Sarina."

"Me too!"

15531.content:
It was three in the morning where Sarina landed on earth. Good thing for her the landing was soft because she felt like she would have broken something otherwise. She stood up and wiped some dust from her toga. That's when she met a recently heartbroken guy named Rob. He just stood there staring at the fallen angel in complete disbelief at what he'd just witnessed. She stared back at him almost expecting him to run away. That's what most angels did in heaven was run from her. Yet he stayed to her surprise.

"Wh-who or what are you?" He finally asked.

"I'm a fallen angel, Sarina." Sarina responded.

"You're a fallen angel? Shouldn't you be a little more... Voluptuous like some sort of fantasy drawing? What did you do to deserve to fall from all this heaven stuff that most people believe in?"

"I only just got kicked out on terms of receiving potentially useful powers from Satan. I didn't even know it was one of Satan's powers but now here I am on earth. I can't answer you on the voluptuous part because like I said I just got kicked out. And thinking about it maybe it was worth it. I mean punishment is either be whipped by God for all of eternity or get kicked out of heaven, never to return. I don't know about you but it doesn't seem worth the so called eternal happiness isn't really accurate. I mean it wasn't like I was miserable all the time but I was almost never happy. From what rare rumors I heard hell wasn't pain and suffering until the end of eternity like God said it was. I've also heard of demons and dark angels having a pretty good time in hell."

"I'm an atheist actually. I don't believe in any of that biblical stuff."

"I could see the logic in that. Hey what was your name again?"

"Rob."

"Hey I remember hearing about a Rob who looked just like you. He had some sort of problems with his cheating girlfriend or something."

"Yeah that's me. I swear she only goes out with guys just because of how attractive they are. She also gets laid too much. When she isn't having sex with one guy she's having sex with some other guy. It's like she wants to get pregnant. She says she doesn't but she also said she wouldn't cheat on me."

"Aww I'm sorry. I still have my powers so I could do something pregnancy related if you want. I've wanted to be pregnant before believe it or not but I can tell you honestly that I wouldn't go around getting laid at every turn just to try and get pregnant."

"I don't know. That just doesn't feel right. I mean we literally just met and now you're talking about magically getting yourself pregnant." Doesn't that seem a bit off to you?"

"It's perfectly normal to fly around heaven and get magically pregnant with angels you've just met actually. God doesn't mind if angels are pregnant as long as they didn't have sex in order to get pregnant or become to pregnant to function what so ever. It's one of those weird things that you wouldn't expect."

"Can I for a second? Aren't you cold? I mean it's the middle of the night during mid fall and you're only wearing a toga."

"Kind of but nothing I can't tolerate."

"Listen I want you to stay at my place for a while until we can get you up to speed with modern culture and stuff."

"Alright if you say so."

info.brief_description: Sarina, the fallen angel, is about to get bigger
info.description:
An expansion/inflation story revolving around a fallen angel named Sarina. She is an average height woman, not skinny but not fat, pretty much flat in every way. The only thing that sets her out is the fact that she has wings (Don't most angels?). The story begins the same way; she falls from heaven and lands somewhere, badly injured, and must heal up before anything can happen. Why she was cast down can be explained in individual story sections. Her long hair of color that changes to fit her mood (don't ask me why, it just does), reaches down to her waist. Her eyes are red and blue individually.
She may be a demi-human or a regular human.
Rules:
1)female expansion only (I'm sorry, but this is focusing on a female angel, so keep the expansion female.)
2)While other women may expand, the focus should be Sarina
3)ANY type of expansion is allowed.
4)Sarina must appear as the above description portrays.
5)If Sarina gains weight, she does not develop rolls and extra chins, as would be realistic. She is an angel, so her angellic beauty keeps wrinkles and skin folds from appearing, which applies to fat rolls, even if those are considered to be beautiful. She gets round, her cheeks get full, but she doesn't get rolls.
